2025.title: CAVIC Festival 2025
2025.brief: Join us for an exciting 3-day festival celebrating the latest advancements in technology. From AI and quantum computing to cybersecurity and digital art, explore how technology is shaping our future across various domains.

sessions.title: Keynote: Quantum Computing: The Next Frontier
sessions.speaker: Dr. Alice Johnson
sessions.description: Dr. Johnson will explore the potential of quantum computing and its implications for various industries.

sessions.title: Panel Discussion: The Ethics of AI
sessions.description: Leading experts discuss the ethical considerations surrounding the development and deployment of AI technologies.

highlights.title: Quantum Computing Demo
highlights.description: Experience the power of quantum computing firsthand

highlights.title: AI Art Exhibition
highlights.description: Explore the intersection of AI and creativity

exhibitions.name: NOK Exhibition
exhibitions.description: Showcasing the latest in Norwegian technology

pressCoverage.title: CAVIC Festival 2025 Showcases Groundbreaking Innovations
pressCoverage.excerpt: The annual CAVIC Festival once again proves to be at the forefront of technological innovation, with quantum computing and AI taking center stage.

pressCoverage.title: How CAVIC Festival 2025 is Redefining the Future of Technology
pressCoverage.excerpt: From AI-powered art to quantum computing demonstrations, CAVIC Festival 2025 offers a glimpse into the future of technology across various industries.

pressCoverage.title: Emerging Trends Spotted at CAVIC Festival 2025
pressCoverage.excerpt: Wired's technology experts break down the most exciting trends and innovations showcased at this year's CAVIC Festival.

2024.title: CAVIC Festival 2024
2024.brief: CAVIC Festival 2024 focuses on the interconnectedness of our digital world. Explore how emerging technologies are bridging gaps and creating new opportunities across industries.

sessions.title: Registration & Networking
sessions.description: Arrival and registration of guests, followed by a networking session.

sessions.title: Opening Ceremony and App Launch
sessions.description: Keynote speeches from dignitaries, including the Honourable Minister of Arts, Culture and Creative Economy. The welcome address will highlight the theme: Interactive Futures: Bridging Realities.

sessions.title: Exhibition Opening: Interactive Futures: Bridging Realities
sessions.description: Unveiling of digital art installations merging traditional Nigerian art with innovative technologies, featuring collaborations between artists from Nigeria and Ghana.

sessions.title: Fashioning the Future: Merging Art, Technology, and Style in Hybrid Realities
sessions.description: This masterclass explores the intersection of fashion, art, and digital technology, focusing on how the boundaries between physical and digital realities are being redefined in the fashion world. Participants will discover how innovations like augmented reality (AR), 3D printing, and digital clothing are transforming design processes, fashion shows, and consumer experiences. The session will also showcase collaborations between artists, technologists, and fashion designers, offering practical insights into creating unique, immersive fashion pieces that blend the virtual with the tangible. Ideal for fashion-forward creatives eager to push the limits of style in the digital era.

sessions.title: Panel Discussion: The Role of Art in Digital Transformation
sessions.description: Exploring how technology is reshaping the creative economy and artistic expressions across Africa.

sessions.title: Street Eats Gallery: Culinary Art Unveiled
sessions.description: A break for attendees to network and discuss the morning sessions over lunch.

sessions.title: Workshop: Cinematic Art: Crafting Visual Narratives to Captivate Audiences
sessions.description: This masterclass delves into the art of videography, focusing on how to craft compelling visual stories that engage and immerse audiences. Tailored for artists and creators, the session explores techniques for blending cinematic visuals with artistic expression, using camera work, editing, and storytelling to evoke emotional and intellectual responses. Participants will learn how to translate artistic concepts into dynamic, moving images, creating videos that resonate with viewers and enhance their experience of visual art. Ideal for videographers and artists interested in expanding their creative toolkit through the power of motion and narrative.

sessions.title: Interactive Digital Performances: Soundscapes & Motion
sessions.description: Performances combining music, dance, and live digital projections, demonstrating the fusion of traditional and modern artistic techniques.

sessions.title: Daily Wrap-Up and Reflections
sessions.description: Recap of the day's activities, feedback from participants, and a preview of Day 3's events.

sessions.title: Open Mic: Emerging Voices in Art and Technology
sessions.description: A platform for local and international artists to perform, present, or share their work in a relaxed and informal setting. A small talk by the president of the African Women Banking Initiative.

sessions.title: Festival Barbecue and Closing Ceremony
sessions.description: A casual and celebratory barbecue to close the festival, including festival highlights, awards presentations for outstanding participants, and an announcement of plans for the 2025 edition of the Cavic Festival.

highlights.title: Life Painting
highlights.description: Team Bingham, comprised of Barka Fori, Monica Emetu, and Kankara Trinity, has brought an innovative twist to the world of art and technology through their project, Neural Style Transfer Live Painting. This creative endeavor merged artificial intelligence and artistic expression to redefine how we experience and interact with visual art in real-time.

highlights.title: Soundsacpe
highlights.description: This installation combines physical musical instruments with virtual reality technology. Visitors can play instruments that directly interact with and influence a virtual environment, creating a unique fusion of musical performance and digital visualization. The experience demonstrates the potential for merging traditional musical expression with contemporary digital technology.

highlights.title: Nok Storybook
highlights.description: This AR application enhances a physical picture book about Nok Art with digital overlays. When viewers point their mobile devices' Google Lens at the book, it projects three-dimensional representations of the artifacts being discussed, allowing for an interactive study of these historical pieces from multiple angles.

highlights.title: Nok VR Experience
highlights.description: This immersive VR exhibition transports visitors into a virtual gallery space where they can encounter five six-foot-tall Nok artifacts at life size. Through VR headsets, viewers can walk around and observe these ancient artworks as if they were physically present, offering an unprecedented way to experience these historical pieces.

highlights.title: Body Dysmorphia
highlights.description: This interactive multimedia installation creates an immersive experience addressing body dysmorphia. Visitors wear headsets to hear real testimonies from individuals living with body dysmorphia. The installation features a mirror that transforms into a 3D semi-abstract painting depicting two grappling bodies. This experience aims to foster empathy and promote kindness by allowing viewers to understand the experiences of body dysmorphia survivors.

highlights.title: Projection Mapping
highlights.description: This installation creates an immersive experience centered around northern Nigerian folklore. Viewers enter a space where constellations are projected on the walls, transforming into architectural designs typical of northern Nigeria. The installation tells the story of 'Bayajidda', a legendary figure who defeated a python to provide clean drinking water for his community. A QR code accompanies the installation, offering a printed version of the folktale for visitors.

exhibitions.name: Connected Home
exhibitions.description: Explore the latest in smart home technology

exhibitions.name: Future of Work
exhibitions.description: Discover how technology is reshaping the workplace

pressCoverage.title: Cavic Art And Tech Launches App To Enhance National Cultural Heritage
pressCoverage.excerpt: The Cavic Art and Tech has launched an Application known as Ojiraeyi APP to enhance National Cultural Heritage World Wide.

pressCoverage.title: Art meets tech at CAVIC 2024 festival
pressCoverage.excerpt: It was a vibrant sight of culture, art, and technology at the 2024 creativity and technology festival, which was held in Abuja on Thursday evening and hosted by the Creative Arts and Visual Imagery Centre CAVIC.

pressCoverage.title: NGA, NICO pledges support for CAVIC to synergise Arts, technology, communication
pressCoverage.excerpt: The National Gallery of  Arts (NGA) and National Institute for Cultural Orientation (NICO) has pledged its support for Creative Arts  and Visual Imaginery Centre (CAVIC) to synergise Arts and technology to enhance communication.

2023.title: CAVIC Festival 2024
2023.theme: Unveiling Abuja's Grand Tapestry of Creativity
2023.brief: CAVIC Festival 2024focuses on the interconnectedness of our digital world. Explore how emerging technologies are bridging gaps and creating new opportunities across industries.

sessions.title: Registration & Welcome
sessions.description: Arrival and registration of guests for the CAVIC Art and Tech Festival.

sessions.title: Opening Ceremony
sessions.description: Official opening of the festival featuring the unveiling of the exhibitions including the Interactive Kinetic Sculpture (KST6), Data Couture, and AI installations.

sessions.title: Exhibition Viewing
sessions.description: Guided tours of the art-tech installations with demonstrations from the artists and creators.

sessions.title: Panel Discussions
sessions.description: Industry experts discuss the intersection of art and technology in Nigeria's creative sector.

sessions.title: Open Mic Session
sessions.description: Creative performances featuring local artists and technologists sharing their work and experiences.

sessions.title: Exhibition Viewing
sessions.description: Open viewing of all installations.

sessions.title: Poetry Reading by Salamatu Sule
sessions.description: Special poetry performance exploring themes of technology and tradition.

sessions.title: Final Exhibition Viewing
sessions.description: Last opportunity to experience the art-tech installations and interact with the creators.

sessions.title: Closing Ceremony
sessions.description: Festival wrap-up and acknowledgments of participating artists and technologists.

highlights.title: Interactive Kinetic Sculpture - KST6
highlights.description: This kinetic sculpture focuses on Sustainable Development Goal 4 (Quality Education). Created with fiber material chosen specifically for its electrical conductivity compatibility, the sculpture modelled by Anyanwu Emmanuel features mechanical movements programmed by 16-year-old automation engineer Anolue Chukwuemeka Patrick. The choice of fiber as the medium demonstrates a thoughtful integration of artistic materials with technological requirements.

highlights.title: Data Couture Collection
highlights.description: This wearable technology collection combines fashion with practical technology solutions, featuring: Wearable tech fashion pieces, Solar rechargeable backpacks, Data protective wallets. The collection demonstrates how fashion can be both functional and protective in the digital age.

highlights.title: AI Animation Installation
highlights.description: This original animation installation focuses on SDG 3 (Good Health and Well-being), exploring the connection between health and wealth. The piece leverages artificial intelligence to create an innovative narrative about health's importance to prosperity.

highlights.title: AI-Infused Paintings
highlights.description: This exhibition combines traditional painting with artificial intelligence, featuring static artworks that extend into animated videos. The pieces demonstrate how traditional art mediums can be enhanced and transformed through digital technology.

exhibitions.description: Explore the latest in smart home technology

exhibitions.name: Future of Work
exhibitions.description: Discover how technology is reshaping the workplace

pressCoverage.title: Cavic Art And Tech Launches App To Enhance National Cultural Heritage
pressCoverage.excerpt: The National Gallery of Art (NGA) has expressed its readiness to collaborate with the private sector using arts and technology to create employment and boost the economy. The Director General of NGA, Mr Ebeten William Ivara stated this at the Maiden edition of the Creative Arts and Visual Imagery Centre’s (CAVIC) Festival of Art and Technology in Abuja.

pressCoverage.title: Art Technology: National Gallery of Art seeks private sector collaboration
pressCoverage.excerpt: The National Gallery of Art (NGA) has expressed its readiness to collaborate with the private sector using arts and technology to create employment and boost the economy. The Director General of NGA, Mr Ebeten William Ivara stated this at the Maiden edition of the Creative Arts and Visual Imagery Centre’s (CAVIC) Festival of Art and Technology in Abuja.
